data.title: Great Place!
data.text: My sister and I were coming back from Nashville and looking for a place to get a glass of wine. We ran across this place by accident. It's in an old house on main street. You can get a table inside or on the porch. We tried some wine from the dispensers then got a bottle and sat on the porch. They have a huge wine selection. We really enjoyed it.

data.title: Fantastic Concept and Great Location
data.text: This little place, located in the heart of historic downtown Franklin, is buzzing with lots of wine options, celebrity spottings, local fare, and great service!  I went there with some friends and had a fabulous time tasting different wines and enjoyed some delicious food!  We started with the Buffalo Chicken Dip and Hummus.  Both were served in generous proportions and tasted wonderful.  We then moved on to enjoy an awesome cheese platter that looked as good as it tasted!  A few of us ordered some flatbreads and really enjoyed those as well. Finally....we ordered a chocolate fondue for dessert.  Decadent!!  And I haven't even mentioned the whole Wine experience, which was fun and educational.  The staff seems to be very knowledgeable about the wines and did a great job recommending wine options to those in our group who were not so savvy about wine.  There were a few guys who aren't really into wine, but were very pleased to find that JJs has a full bar with premium liquor and a nice cocktail list.  I'd never experienced the concept of a wine-dispensing machine, but am so glad I got to try this concept out at JJs.  You can choose from almost 30 types of wine, pouring either a one-ounce, five-ounce, or eight-ounce pour.  What a fun way to try wine!  They also have a hefty bottle list, but we were having too much fun with the wine machines!  You can sit inside in their lounge, where the chairs are comfortable and low, and are surrounding a cocktail table, or you can sit in one of their dining rooms at a table. We ventured out to the porch and enjoyed spending the rest of the evening people watching and having a great time.  they also have a quite a bit of seating in the front of the restaurant, if you prefer to sit outside. I LOVED the ladies room at JJs; very stylishly decorated and fun.  And I heard that the men's room is something to see as well.  While were there, a large party arrived and were escorted to one of the party rooms where they had a private party and seemed to be having a blast!  I would definitely look into JJs Wine Bar if I have a private event coming up in the future.  The owners, who were both onsite, were nice and inviting.  They explained how one of them had opened JJs several years ago and the other, who was a long-time customer recently became a partner.  Seemed like they really enjoyed working together.

data.title: Cool, fun concept for wine drinkers
data.text: We didn't know what to expect when we walked into JJ's and saw the wine dispensers on the walls, but it turned out to be one of the coolest wine concepts we've ever encountered. Being able to walk around and have our own tasting was great, as was the outdoor seating. If you like wine, and want some fresh air, this is the place to go.

data.title: A pleasant surprise!
data.text: We had time to kill before dinner so we stopped to see what this was about. Passed by it more than a few times but never had time to stop. Interesting concept. You give them your credit card in exchange for a self-serve card that allows you to sample (1 oz.) or buy wine in 4 or 8 ounce servings. 20ish choices: red, white, and some higher shelf. They also had a menu from which we had smoked salmon crostinis that were tasty. I can't see staying for hours, but for a glass or two it's well worth it!

data.title: Quaint Quiet and Friendly Place
data.text: After walking all around downtown Franklin we were ready for a relaxing place to sit and rest before dinner..this was the place to do it.  We sat out on the front porch which was so cute and had a wonderful glass of wine.  they actually have dispensable wine machines so you can buy a "tour of wines" or something like that with a variety of tastings, we just did wine by the glass which was fine, they also had some really good sounding appetizers for only $5 or so during their afternoon special but we didn't try any as we had dinner reservations elsewhere.  The porch overlooks one of the first and oldest civil war hospitals in TN (it is kitty corner from the porch) it is so small, can't imagine being able to treat more than 2 people at a time!  Our waiter told us that as well as the fact that every year this strange flock of birds come in at a particular time of year and they all fly down the chimney one after another and people come to watch it...strange!  Franklin is a cool old town with lots to offer.

data.title: Not A Fan
data.text: Quiet, sterile atmosphere without background music, TV or other diversion.  Selp help wine service with a multi step process for pouring/payment.  Will not go back.

data.title: After work wine
data.text:
Excellent place to meet friends after work!
I've not had dinner there, but the snack dishes are excellent.

data.title: Fun Idea but Not Fully Realized and I Don't Think it will Last...
data.text:
I loved the idea of the wine-dispensing machines but it wore thin pretty quickly. For as good as it sounds... it is very impersonal.

First you go in and hand over your debit or credit card in exchange for a wine card that can be used in the machines. There is a machine with a number of whites, one for reds and one for premium wines. You have a choice of a 1 ounce "taste" - or a 5 ounce "half glass" or a 7+ ounce "full glass."

Sounds good, but overall there weren't that many wines to choose from. At any rate, I chose a half glass of white bordeaux since that was something I hadn't had before. I went out to the front porch to get a table and enjoy it.

The server was a nice young man who tried to talk me into some food but I wasn't sure I wanted to eat here. He left me a menu to look at and I went back in to get a taste of a premium wine. There were only a few so I chose the most expensive. Instead of $1.50 or so for a taste. like most, a taste of this Napa Valley White was $4.75. I got the one ounce and savored it. Quite good.

Then I decided I WOULD order some food so I got a half glass of a Malbec from Argentina to go with the Black and Blue Flatbread (herbed cheese, roast beef, bleu cheese, mozzarella and sweet onions on a flatbread.) It was rich in berry flavors and mildly tannic. Smooth going down.

But later I looked up these wines and was disappointed with what I found...

The white bordeaux was $7.20 for a half glass at JJ's. That same bottle, which is only rated a 3.9, costs $8 retail. Hardly a good wine.

The expensive "taste" - a 2012 Palazzo White - sells a bottle at retail for $55. The full glass price at JJ's is $34.

Lastly, the Malbec from Argentina - which I paid $7.50 for a half glass - sells for $10 a bottle retail.

So let's think about this... Surely a wine bar buys in volume, at wholesale, so these are markups of 500-600 per cent at the least. Hardly a good buy. And I do realize that they need a certain markup to make a profit, but this is either a ripoff or an effort to pay off some expensive machinery. Not to mention that you essentially wait on yourself!

The "black and blue flatbread" was tasty, but shouldn't it be Black and BLEU, considering the BLEU comes from the cheese used? Doesn't "blue" mean "raw" when it comes to steak or beef??? How can a legitimate restaurant get this terminology confused? Especially when they are trying to be so high brow???

So while I enjoyed a couple hours on the porch in the evening at JJ's, I wouldn't go back based on the lack of intelligent entree labeling and the overpricing of such mediocre wines. I would much rather go buy a decent bottle (or get a case price) and invite friends over to my own patio. The machines are a gimmick. I don't think they'll last.

Strictly average experience... which will be poor when the newness wears off.

Oh! And by the way... I went to get my debit card out of my wallet when it was time to pay and panicked for a few minutes because it was gone. I emptied out my purse looking for it until I remembered I had given it to the cashier to get the wine card to use. Phew! When I mentioned this to her, she commented that people routinely panic when they realize their credit card it missing until they remember she has it. That was NOT fun! And I don't think it is a good idea to turn over a card to ANYONE for several hours. I won't do that again, either!

data.title: Sue me, I like JJ's
data.text: This little wine bar is very comfortable - like hanging out at a good friend's house. The staff is laid back, but helpful. JJ's is definitely a great place for a glass of wine, some munchies, and good adult conversation. Highly recommended.

data.title: Unique Ambiance
data.text: Enjoyed dining at JJ's with a group of girl friends. The back room was reserved for our group of about a dozen of us. I had the Black and Blue Artisan Flat-bread and it was very good. I had their special lemon Martini which was perfect. The friends at our table shared several internationally themed antipastos. I will make sure I try the wine station which allows to to pay for a taste, half glass or full glass of wine next time. Our server was friendly. My only critique is that it took a bit of time for us to receive our orders and they were randomly brought to us. Overall, I would recommend going to JJ's and would definitely return.

data.title: Don't bring the kids
data.text: It was fun to be able to taste different wines, and decide how much you get to drink. We sat outside on a beautiful evening. My husband and I both got flatbreads which were delicious. It was reasonably priced.

data.title: Intimate Setting for Date Night
data.text: Enjoyed the intimate setting... comfy chairs, low lighting, self serve wine dispenser, nice menu selections = a fun start to  date night.  Thanks to JJ's wine selections we have now added a few favorites to our wine rack at home.  Already planning a few more return trips with friends and family.

data.title: A cozy was to end your evening!
data.text: Nice wine selection. You have the option from a tasting to a full glass. I didn't try any food selections but will on my next time around. Cozy, intimate, friendly.

data.title: Afternoon break while shopping.
data.text: Stopped in for a break while Christmas shopping in downtown Franklin.  It is a very interesting concept and friendly staff.  Wine selection was adequate...not great and prices were high but not ridiculous.   I would describe food as "typical bar fare at best"... Ok for snacks with wine.

data.title: Really Love The New Menu
data.text: JJ's has been one of two favorite drink spots for a long time, and recently we've been there more often because the new menu has really caught our attention.  A few recommendations -- the truffled cashews, the caprese salad, and definitely the fondue!  If you've never been to this type of place before, the self-service wine stations are a lot of fun.  Probably 30+ wines you can try by the glass (taste, half, or full) -- and a great variety of white and red.  Plus there is a full bar (beer, spirits, etc.).

data.title: Nice idea, but very expensive
data.text:
We had an arranged gathering last evening at JJ's.  We had prepurchased $100 worth of appetizers and couples bought their wine.
When you arrive at JJ's you are met at the door by the "cashier" who takes your credit card in exchange for a JJ's card to be used at their wine vending machines.  I relied on my husband to choose a pinot noir for me.  I accompanied a member of our party to the white wine machines to help figure out the machine system and was amazed at the cost of a half glass and a "taste" of each wine.  The selection didn't seem as varied as you might think for a wine bar.  Perhaps they change the wines regularly?
Our choices and quantities of the appetizers placed in our room was meager, at best.  They clearly subscribed to the less is more cuisine approach where the items were spread out on a large plate.
The atmosphere was pleasant, but I would prefer to enjoy my glass of wine at home.
Upon leaving we were presented with the bill and the tip was mentioned by the cashier.  I kept wondering what we were tipping for since we served ourselves.
Overall just an okay experience.  Been there but probably won't return.

data.title: Very nice and inviting
data.text: Came here twice today because we enjoyed the atmosphere and selection of wines. Sitting outside on the porch was a perfect way to end a visit to this quaint town. Will come back again.

data.title: Better than meeting for coffee
data.text: It is so easy to say, "ok, let's meet at Starbucks," but sometimes near Music City USA, or in Franklin USA, this kind of place serves better. I love the small rooms with the excellent leather couches and the simple idea of getting a glass and then having whatever and however much. Maybe take coffee with your meetings, but if you take wine, JJ's Might be your spot. The less than 5 is due to the food menu. JJ's, your customers want small, delicious bites to accompany your wines, and that is all. Do this well.

data.title: Pre-dinner stop
data.text: Stopped in with friend before dinner.  We enjoyed tasting some good wines, nice not to have to commit to a bottle.  you can choose your 'pour'  size the restored house was inviting, casual couch seating or tables,  the front porch had seating as well.  Extra bonus was the print out at the end of the wines you tasted. We will go back when in Franklin again.

data.title: Nice wines...perfect pre-Dinner stop!
data.text: Framily of four enjoyed an hour at JJ's before dinner reservations elsewhere at 8:30 on a Saturday.  The bar was full of nicely dressed people enjoying good wine.  There was pleasant music in one of the rooms of this beautifully restored older home.  The staff was nice and happy to answer any questions.  This is a great way to "taste" wines without committing to an entire bottle.  When you check out, you get a printout of the wines you tried so you can have a reminder when shopping at your local bottle shop...nice touch.
